description._content: Grit and Glamour My table design explores spring in Brooklyn and utilizes the beauty found in cast off objects found there such as copper pennies, tempered automobile glass, and barbed wire. The central objects on my table are two large candelabras constructed from pennies and copper plumbing fittings. There are also several smaller versions and some small nest sculptures made from barbed wire dispersed throughout the length of the table. All of this is displayed on a table runner covered with silk screened “Ghetto Blaster” imagery. Each place setting has a silk screened model cassette which guests are allowed to take with them as a gift if they choose. The Brooklyn Ball 2011 celebrates the art, creativity, and influence of Brooklyn artists and the Museum’s role as a cultural gateway. This year’s Ball is being designed in partnership with Brooklyn artists to create an evening filled with art, ideas, and surprises. Felicia Wong photo, Brooklyn Museum
